<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King. A proclamation for the free and lawfull use of maulting. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Majestie: and by the assignes of John Bill, Imprinted at London : 1638.
Dated at end: ... Greenwich the eighteenth day of Iune, in the fourteenth yeer of His Majesties reign. Arms 21 (with two leaves under the lion's leg); Steele notation: Proclamation the Mault-. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
By the King. A proclamation for the free and lawfull use of maulting. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Majestie: and by the assignes of John Bill, Imprinted at London : 1638.
Dated at end: ... Greenwich the eighteenth day of Iune, in the fourteenth yeer of His Majesties reign. Arms 21 (with two leaves under the lion's leg); Steele notation: Proclamation the Mault-. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
the Kings most excellent Majestie: and
Robert Barker
John Bill
